title: What are some old school, feel good hip hop songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi,how are you doing?i hope well,anyway i really honestly think that quora is one of the best platform online, quora is a God bless platform, they help people like me,to reach out to people to help save their life's, i really love quora, anyway,i love all musicians, but i as a Christian musician, is not allowed by Christ,to listen to songs that put down females or support violence, once the song is about peace and love,and is uplifting, i love it and will listen to it,anyway here are some rappers and other hip hop musicians, i think is great musicians, there are thousands more that i heard,that are great musicians, that is not in this list Hip Hop has taken a bad rap. Mostly because the labels and the media choose to only promote the most negative music to make money. Still Hip Hop has a long history of positive uplifting songs. Here’s my Top 9. 9. Ed O G And The Bulldogs Be A Father To Your Child. Dope ode to to fatherhood with a great positive message to young black men. 8. Queen Latifah U.N.I.T.Y. Queen Latifah’s song both discourages misogyny and encourage unity in this early 90s classic. 7. Kool G. Rap Ft. Biz Markie And Big Daddy Kane Erase Racism Great song about the evils of racism and how to stop it from three of the Juice Crew All-Stars. 6. Gang West Coast All Stars We’re All In The Same King Tee, NWA, MC Hammer, Digital Underground, Ice-T and several other West Coast stars came together to try and stop the gang violence that plagued the West Coast in the nineties. 5. BDP You Must Learn KRS kicks a dope Black history lesson on the mic for the BDP gem. 4. Lauryn Hill That Thing Great song about women and self respect by Lauryn. 3. Public Enemy Fight The Power An anthem to revolutions everywhere. PE rallied the sufferers to fight against their oppressors and not just tolerate it. 2. The Stop The Violence Movement Self Destruction KRS-One, Big Daddy Kane, D-Nice, MC Lyte, Public Enemy and others came together to fight against Black on Black crime. 1. Slick Rick Hey Young World Great inspirational song for our youth with wisdom and life lessons included.

Hmmm my favourites off the top of my head must be: Grandmaster Flash - White Lines Grandmaster Flash is an absolute MUST for old school hip-hop - The Message, White Lines. Guy was pretty popular in the 90s.  Beastie Boys - Intergalactic  Salt N' Peppa' - Push It Perhaps more of a late 80's - early 90's vibe to this song but technically by a hip hop group :D  If you're looking for more 'hip-hoppy' songs by Salt N' Peppa' though, I suggest Blacks Magic. Got the record myself at home and I love playing it when I need my old-school hip-hop pickup.  Whodini -Freaks Come Out at Night My dad happened to be a fan of Whodini so I got a lot of his old records and discovered these bad boys. Their song Friends might be their most famous, most sampled song.
